main event: A round, bright object was observed landing in the sky near Hawthorn, California in August 1957.
interesting points: The object was at the approximate position of an estimated star in the sky and was seen directly above the observer.
The object moved from north to west, back and forth.
The object was described as a round, bright object that landed.

Two well-qualified observers in the control tower at Los Angeles International Airport reported seeing three glowing objects at different times, with the first one appearing brilliant white and very high, and the last two being described as low and orange in color.
Additional civilian personnel at the control tower also reported seeing the objects.
sighted object: A round, bright object that landed; three glowing objects observed at different times
location: Hawthorn, California; 2 miles east of Los Angeles International Airport
witnesses: A civilian observer; control tower operators at Los Angeles International Airport
photographs: No photographs were present in the report
